poem:
Title: "The Silent Bell of Dawn in Rafah"

In the untethered shadows, Rafah whispers,
A hymn of war, a chant for peace.
Steel giants roam her tender skin,
Denying her fruits their release.

Dust-laden tales of suffering,
Tethered to the cries of newborn Feathers,
Detained is the salve of healing,
Barren lies the east, bereft of weathers.

"Advance," says the dawn, 
But the dawn in Rafah sleeps, in quiet despair.
